trans-unit.source: Service Bus Architecture
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Architecture

trans-unit.source: Describes the message processing architecture of Azure Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: Describes the message processing architecture of Azure Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: The following section describes the message processing architecture of Azure Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: The following section describes the message processing architecture of Azure Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus is organized by scale units.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus is organized by scale units.

trans-unit.source: A scale unit is a unit of deployment and contains all components required run the service.
trans-unit.target: A scale unit is a unit of deployment and contains all components required run the service.

trans-unit.source: Each region deploys one or more Service Bus scale units.
trans-unit.target: Each region deploys one or more Service Bus scale units.

trans-unit.source: A Service Bus namespace is mapped to a scale unit.
trans-unit.target: A Service Bus namespace is mapped to a scale unit.

trans-unit.source: The scale unit handles all types of Service Bus entities: relays, brokered messaging entities (queues, topics, subscriptions), and notification hubs.
trans-unit.target: The scale unit handles all types of Service Bus entities: relays, brokered messaging entities (queues, topics, subscriptions), and notification hubs.

trans-unit.source: A Service Bus scale unit consists of the following components:
trans-unit.target: A Service Bus scale unit consists of the following components:

trans-unit.source: A set of gateway nodes. Gateway nodes authenticate incoming requests and handle relay requests.
trans-unit.target: A set of gateway nodes. Gateway nodes authenticate incoming requests and handle relay requests.

trans-unit.source: Each gateway node has a public IP address.
trans-unit.target: Each gateway node has a public IP address.

trans-unit.source: A set of messaging broker nodes. Messaging broker nodes process requests concerning messaging entities.
trans-unit.target: A set of messaging broker nodes. Messaging broker nodes process requests concerning messaging entities.

trans-unit.source: A set of notification nodes. Notification nodes send push notifications to all registered devices.
trans-unit.target: A set of notification nodes. Notification nodes send push notifications to all registered devices.

trans-unit.source: One gateway store. The gateway store holds the data for every entity that is defined in this scale unit.
trans-unit.target: One gateway store. The gateway store holds the data for every entity that is defined in this scale unit.

trans-unit.source: The gateway store is implemented on top of a SQL Azure database.
trans-unit.target: The gateway store is implemented on top of a SQL Azure database.

trans-unit.source: Many messaging stores. The messaging stores hold the messages of all queues, topics and subscriptions that are defined in this scale unit.
trans-unit.target: Many messaging stores. The messaging stores hold the messages of all queues, topics and subscriptions that are defined in this scale unit.

trans-unit.source: It also contains all subscription data.
trans-unit.target: It also contains all subscription data.

trans-unit.source: Unless <linkText>Partitioning Messaging Entities</linkText><title></title> is enabled, a queue or topic is mapped to one messaging store.
trans-unit.target: Unless <linkText>Partitioning Messaging Entities</linkText><title></title> is enabled, a queue or topic is mapped to one messaging store.

trans-unit.source: Subscriptions are stored in the same messaging store as their parent topic.
trans-unit.target: Subscriptions are stored in the same messaging store as their parent topic.

trans-unit.source: The messaging stores are implemented on top of SQL Azure databases.
trans-unit.target: The messaging stores are implemented on top of SQL Azure databases.

trans-unit.source: Multiple registration stores. The registration stores contain device registrations for all notification hubs that are defined in this scale unit.
trans-unit.target: Multiple registration stores. The registration stores contain device registrations for all notification hubs that are defined in this scale unit.

trans-unit.source: The registration stores are implemented on top of SQL Azure databases.
trans-unit.target: The registration stores are implemented on top of SQL Azure databases.

trans-unit.source: Each messaging entity is assigned a specific container.
trans-unit.target: Each messaging entity is assigned a specific container.

trans-unit.source: A container is a logical construct that uses exactly one messaging store to store all relevant data for this container.
trans-unit.target: A container is a logical construct that uses exactly one messaging store to store all relevant data for this container.

trans-unit.source: Each container is assigned to a messaging broker node.
trans-unit.target: Each container is assigned to a messaging broker node.

trans-unit.source: Typically, there are more containers than messaging broker nodes.
trans-unit.target: Typically, there are more containers than messaging broker nodes.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, each messaging broker node loads multiple containers.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, each messaging broker node loads multiple containers.

trans-unit.source: The distribution of containers to a messaging broker node is organized such that all messaging broker nodes are equally loaded.
trans-unit.target: The distribution of containers to a messaging broker node is organized such that all messaging broker nodes are equally loaded.

trans-unit.source: If the load pattern changes (for example, one of the containers gets very busy), or if a messaging broker node becomes temporarily unavailable, the containers are redistributed among the messaging broker nodes.
trans-unit.target: If the load pattern changes (for example, one of the containers gets very busy), or if a messaging broker node becomes temporarily unavailable, the containers are redistributed among the messaging broker nodes.

trans-unit.source: When a client sends a request to Service Bus, the Azure load balancer routes it to any of the gateway nodes.
trans-unit.target: When a client sends a request to Service Bus, the Azure load balancer routes it to any of the gateway nodes.

trans-unit.source: The gateway node authorizes the request.
trans-unit.target: The gateway node authorizes the request.

trans-unit.source: If the request concerns a messaging entity (queue, topic, subscription), the gateway node looks up the entity in the gateway store and determines in which messaging store the entity is located.
trans-unit.target: If the request concerns a messaging entity (queue, topic, subscription), the gateway node looks up the entity in the gateway store and determines in which messaging store the entity is located.

trans-unit.source: It then looks up which messaging broker node is currently servicing this container, and sends the request to that messaging broker node.
trans-unit.target: It then looks up which messaging broker node is currently servicing this container, and sends the request to that messaging broker node.

trans-unit.source: The messaging broker node processes the request and updates the entity state in the container store.
trans-unit.target: The messaging broker node processes the request and updates the entity state in the container store.

trans-unit.source: The messaging broker node then sends the response back to the gateway node, which sends an appropriate response back to the client that issued the original request.
trans-unit.target: The messaging broker node then sends the response back to the gateway node, which sends an appropriate response back to the client that issued the original request.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Processing of Incoming Messaging Requests</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Processing of Incoming Messaging Requests</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When a client sends a request to Service Bus, the Azure load balancer routes it to any of the gateway nodes.
trans-unit.target: When a client sends a request to Service Bus, the Azure load balancer routes it to any of the gateway nodes.

trans-unit.source: If the request is a listening request, the gateway node creates a new relay.
trans-unit.target: If the request is a listening request, the gateway node creates a new relay.

trans-unit.source: If the request is a connection request to a specific relay, the gateway node forwards the connection request to the gateway node that owns the relay.
trans-unit.target: If the request is a connection request to a specific relay, the gateway node forwards the connection request to the gateway node that owns the relay.

trans-unit.source: The gateway node that owns the relay sends a rendezvous request to the listening client, asking the listener to create a temporary channel to the gateway node that received the connection request.
trans-unit.target: The gateway node that owns the relay sends a rendezvous request to the listening client, asking the listener to create a temporary channel to the gateway node that received the connection request.

trans-unit.source: When the relay connection is established, the clients can exchange messages via the gateway node that is used for the rendezvous.
trans-unit.target: When the relay connection is established, the clients can exchange messages via the gateway node that is used for the rendezvous.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Processing of Incoming Relay Requests</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Processing of Incoming Relay Requests</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When a client sends a request to Service Bus, the Azure load balancer routes it to any of the gateway nodes.
trans-unit.target: When a client sends a request to Service Bus, the Azure load balancer routes it to any of the gateway nodes.

trans-unit.source: If the request is a device registration for an existing notification hub, the gateway node writes the registration to the registration store and sends a reply to the calling device.
trans-unit.target: If the request is a device registration for an existing notification hub, the gateway node writes the registration to the registration store and sends a reply to the calling device.

trans-unit.source: If the request is a notification message, the gateway node enqueues the message into a notification queue.
trans-unit.target: If the request is a notification message, the gateway node enqueues the message into a notification queue.

trans-unit.source: One of the notification nodes dequeues the message from the notification queue and sends the message to all devices that are registered in the registration store.
trans-unit.target: One of the notification nodes dequeues the message from the notification queue and sends the message to all devices that are registered in the registration store.

trans-unit.source: If a message is to be received by a large number of devices, multiple notification nodes participate in sending the messages to the devices.
trans-unit.target: If a message is to be received by a large number of devices, multiple notification nodes participate in sending the messages to the devices.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Processing of Incoming Notification Hub Requests</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Processing of Incoming Notification Hub Requests</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now that you've read an overview of how Service Bus works, to get started visit the following links:
trans-unit.target: Now that you've read an overview of how Service Bus works, to get started visit the following links:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Service Bus messaging overview</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Service Bus fundamentals</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>A queued messaging solution using Service Bus queues</linkText><title></title>
